bug.author: H4dr1en
bug.summary: Engine restarts training from scratch unexpected
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug description</denchmark-h>
Engine _is_done function only takes into account max_epochs parameter read from the state of the object. This leads to the followling unexpected behavior:
Instantiate a simple engine, train for 2 epochs (set max_epochs=2). Save checkpoints. Train for 2 more epochs (set max_epochs=4) using last checkpoint. This leads to the training restarting from scratch instead of continuing from the last checkpoint.
Why? Engine.run functions has a parameter that should have the precedence over the stored in the checkpoint state in the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/ignite/blob/master/ignite/engine/engine.py#L605>_is_done</denchmark-link> . Currently, at runtime, to check if the training is done, we consider from the state of the checkpoint, not the parameter from the user. Therefore if the user specifies a different value (in the case he wants to train for more epochs), his input is not taken into account. Here is a possible workaround to explain how to solve the problem: <denchmark-code> @staticmethod def _is_done(state, max_epochs=None): return state.iteration == state.epoch_length * (state.max_epochs if max_epochs is None else max_epochs) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.4): 1.4.0 Ignite Version (e.g., 0.3.0): 0.3.0 OS (e.g., Linux): macOS How you installed Ignite (conda, pip, source): pip Python version: 3.6.10 Any other relevant information:

torch.manual_seed(12)
def train_step(trainer, batch): s = trainer.state print( "{}/{} : {} - {:.3f}".format(s.epoch, s.max_epochs, s.iteration, batch) )
trainer = Engine(train_step) trainer.logger = setup_logger()
saved_states = []
# This emulates Checkpoint to save trainer and others @trainer.on(Events.COMPLETED) def save_state(): saved_states.append(trainer.state_dict())
data = [0, 1, 2]
trainer.run(data, max_epochs=2) print(saved_states)
